data.content:
Động từ
(cách viết khác disfavour)
sự không tán thàn, sự ghét bỏ

noun
US or Brit disfavour
[noncount] formal
a feeling of disapproval or dislike
He regarded their proposal with disfavor.
They looked with disfavor upon her.
the condition of being disapproved of or disliked
The theory has long been in disfavor. [=the theory has been unpopular for a long time]
The style fell into disfavor [=became unpopular] a decade ago.
verb
US or Brit disfavour -vors; -vored; -voring
[+ obj] formal
to disapprove of or dislike (someone or something)
Some bar owners disfavor [=(more commonly) are against] the ban on smoking.
to make it more difficult for (a person, organization, etc.) to succeed or achieve something than it is for another person, organization, etc.
The current laws favor large businesses and disfavor smaller businesses.
